text: Jean-Baptiste Alphonse Karr (24 November 1808 - 29 September 1890) was a French critic, journalist, and novelist. His brother Eug√®ne was a talented engineer, and his niece Carme Karr was a writer, journalist and suffragist in La Roche-Mabile. In 1839 Alphonse Karr became editor of Le Figaro. Karr was born in Paris and died in Saint-Raphael, Var. The bamboo species Bambusa multiplex Alphonse Karr was named in his honour. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1808 births Category:1890 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:French critics Category:French journalists Category:Writers from Paris
title: Jean-Baptiste Alphonse Karr
